doc.previous: A simple example of a field is the field of rational numbers consisting of numbers which can be written as fractions a b where a and b are integers and b 0 The additive inverse of such a fraction is simply a b and the multiplicative inverse provided that a 0 is b a To see the latter note that
doc.after: The abstractly required field axioms reduce to standard properties of rational numbers such as the law of distributivity
